author: potuz
content: Can I ask roughly what would constitute a testnet for the merge? Even assuming that executable beacon chain as it stands now is the way to go, surely testing in Goerli is not representative of reality

author: .vbuterin
content: Theoretically you could make a testnet that just folds in eth1 mainnet state, no?

author: ryanleeschneider
content: Is that something that any of the current clients have support for?  Basically something like "sync mainnet up to block X then after that only accept blocks from the testnet chainid"?

author: .vbuterin
content: The merge itself is an exercise of "sync one blockchain up to block X, and then use the post-state of that as a genesis state for the other blockchain starting from slot Y"

author: .vbuterin
content: So I don't see why you can't just use mainnet

author: .vbuterin
content: I wonder why the thumbs down here. Legislation banning PoW is not an attack in the sense of being an expression of hostility against the Ethereum community (because the ethereum community broadly has no love of PoW either), but it _is_ an event that could warrant an accelerated response. Or is that aspect negligible because realistically it would only get banned in a few countries at a time anyway so there's no rush?
